page.title: 06DESCRIPTION OF FINDON VALLEY
page.content: Findon Valley is situated to the North-West of Worthing.It is 41m above sea level with a population of 1,665. Findon Valley is 2.06 km2 in area, occupies a narrow valley between two steep chalk inclines,(Cissbury Ring to the East and High Salvington to the West).Thus the environment is often polluted by trffic noise and exhaust fumes from the A24 bisecting the area. This is a developing area,the elderly population is declining,the retirement bungalows are being replaced by executive houses infilling former large gardens,while younger people are now living in the valley. Residents anticipate a future motorway through the area,and because of the scarcity of building land in Worthing, Findon Valley will become another urban sprawl,losing its village identity.
